content:
Diagnosis:

Locally advanced laryngeal squamous cell carcinoma T3N2bM0, p16 negative, PDL1 CPS 60

Previous treatment:
Induction TPF chemotherapy March-May 2024 - 3 cycles completed
Planned for concurrent chemoradiation

Previous medical history:
Type 2 diabetes
Hypertension
Chronic kidney disease stage 3

Current medications:
Metformin 1g BD
Ramipril 5mg OD
Amlodipine 10mg OD

Allergies:
Penicillin - rash

Current situation:
Post induction chemotherapy assessment

CT neck 12 June 2024 shows partial response with primary tumor reduction from 4.2cm to 2.8cm and reduction in nodal disease volume

I reviewed [redacted name] today following completion of induction TPF chemotherapy. The treatment has been challenging with grade 3 mucositis during cycle 2 requiring brief admission for supportive care, and grade 2 peripheral neuropathy affecting hands and feet. Despite these challenges, radiological assessment shows encouraging partial response. However, given the toxicity profile and impact on performance status, which has declined from PS 0 to PS 2, we have decided to modify our treatment approach.

Rather than proceeding with concurrent cisplatin-based chemoradiation as originally planned, we will now proceed with radiotherapy alone using an accelerated fractionation schedule (66Gy in 30 fractions over 6 weeks). This decision takes into account his reduced performance status, cumulative cisplatin exposure, and borderline renal function with current eGFR 45.

I have discussed this change in treatment plan with [redacted name] and his wife. They understand the rationale and agree with this modified approach. We have arranged radiotherapy planning CT for next week with aim to commence treatment in 2 weeks time. He will be reviewed weekly during radiotherapy in the combined head and neck clinic. I have also arranged urgent dental assessment and speech and language therapy review prior to starting radiation.
